title: What's Your Parenting Style?
description: Discover your natural parenting approach — are you the steady explainer, the firm boundary-setter, or the free-spirited adventurer?
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your complete parenting style profile
previewCta.body: Your detailed blend across all three approaches — which instincts are strongest, where you flex, and specific tips to lean into your natural strengths.

notes: Already built as Likert. Also has a forced-choice variant at /quiz/parenting-approach.

title: What's Your Parenting Approach?
description: 10 real parenting scenarios — pick what you'd actually do and find out which approach drives your instincts.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your complete parenting approach profile
previewCta.body: Your primary approach explained — why it works, where to watch out, your unique strengths as a parent, and a concrete action plan.

notes: Already built. Forced-choice alternative to the Likert version.

title: What's Your Bedtime Battle Style?
description: Every family's bedtime looks different. Find out which bedtime warrior you are — and why it's working better than you think.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your bedtime battle survival guide
previewCta.body: Your style explained — why you default to it, what's secretly working, the one tweak that would make the biggest difference, and scripts for your toughest bedtime moments.

title: Are You Repeating Your Parents' Patterns?
description: Not a therapy session — just an honest look at which patterns you're carrying forward, which you've dropped, and where you're still figuring it out.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your complete pattern profile
previewCta.body: Which patterns you've kept, which you've broken, and the specific places where your childhood still shows up in your parenting — plus what to do about it.

title: What Kind of Worried Parent Are You?
description: All parents worry — yours just has a specific flavor. Find out your worry style and why it actually makes sense.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your worry style decoded
previewCta.body: Why your brain does this, what it's actually protecting, the specific triggers to watch for, and 3 evidence-based techniques matched to your worry style.

title: What's Your Parenting Love Language?
description: You show your kid you love them every day — but how? Discover which love channel you default to.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your parenting love language profile
previewCta.body: Your primary and secondary channels — how your child actually receives them, specific ways to amplify what's already working, and how to speak your child's language back.

title: How Would Your Kid Describe You?
description: Answer about your habits — get back a portrait of yourself through your child's eyes. Warning: it might make you cry.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your child's-eye-view profile
previewCta.body: The full portrait through your kid's eyes — what they notice most, what they'll remember when they're grown, and the specific moments that are building your relationship.

title: What's Your Parenting Superpower?
description: You have one — even on the days it doesn't feel like it. Take 2 minutes and find out what your kids are lucky to have.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your superpower field guide
previewCta.body: How your superpower shows up in daily parenting, the situations where it shines brightest, the blind spot that comes with it, and how to use it deliberately when things get hard.

title: What Kind of Parent Are You at 2 AM?
description: The mask comes off at 2 AM. Find out which exhausted alter-ego runs the show when the sun is down.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your 2 AM survival profile
previewCta.body: Why your brain defaults to this mode, what it says about your stress response, and specific middle-of-the-night strategies designed for your alter-ego.

title: What's Your Parenting Era?
description: Gentle parenting purist? Chaos realist? 80s free-range throwback? Find your era.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your parenting era decoded
previewCta.body: Where your era comes from, what's working about it, the one thing your era tends to overcorrect on, and how to keep the best parts while dropping the rest.

title: What Kind of Co-Parent Team Are You?
description: Both partners take it. Find out what kind of tag team you've become — and why it's probably working better than you think.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your co-parenting team playbook
previewCta.body: How your team dynamic works, the friction points to watch for, and specific conversation starters that help your particular team style run smoother.

title: Is Your Toddler Ready for Potty Training?
description: Skip the guessing. Answer 8 quick questions and find out if your toddler is showing the signs — or if waiting a bit longer will save everyone tears.
subject: your child

previewCta.title: Get your toddler's complete potty readiness report
previewCta.body: Exactly which signs are strong, which aren't there yet, and a step-by-step starting plan matched to where your child actually is — not a generic timeline.

title: Is Your Child Ready for Kindergarten?
description: Not just ABCs — the real skills that predict a smooth start. See where your child shines and where a little practice helps.
subject: your child

previewCta.title: Get your child's kindergarten readiness report
previewCta.body: A detailed breakdown across all four skill areas — where they're ahead, where to focus this summer, and fun daily activities that build the skills that matter most.

title: Is Your Baby Ready for Solid Foods?
description: Age alone doesn't tell you. Check the actual developmental signs that say your baby is ready to start eating.
subject: your baby

previewCta.title: Get your baby's complete solids readiness report
previewCta.body: Which developmental signs are present, which to wait for, recommended first foods for your baby's stage, and a week-by-week introduction plan.

title: Is Your Child Ready to Drop the Nap?
description: The nap is sacred — until it starts ruining bedtime. Find out if it's time to let go or hold on a little longer.
subject: your child

previewCta.title: Get your nap transition game plan
previewCta.body: Whether to drop it now or hold on, a day-by-day transition schedule if it's time, and exactly how to handle the cranky 4pm window.

title: Is Your Child Ready for a Sleepover?
description: It's not about age — it's about whether YOUR kid has the specific skills to handle a night away. Check the real signs.
subject: your child

previewCta.title: Get your child's sleepover readiness report
previewCta.body: Which skills are solid, which need practice first, a prep checklist for before the big night, and exactly what to say if they call wanting to come home.

title: Is Your Family Ready for a Second Child?
description: The biological clock is ticking but is the rest of you ready? An honest check across the dimensions that actually matter.
subject: your family

previewCta.title: Get your complete family readiness report
previewCta.body: An honest breakdown across all four dimensions — what's strong, what needs attention first, and a practical pre-baby checklist based on your specific situation.

title: How's Your Parenting Battery Right Now?
description: Rate a few statements about your week and see where you're charged, where you're running low, and what would actually help.
subject: you

previewCta.title: Get your complete energy profile with recharge plan
previewCta.body: Which reserves are drained, which are holding up, and specific daily micro-actions to recharge the ones running lowest — matched to YOUR life, not generic self-care advice.

title: How Screen-Dependent Is Your Family?
description: No judgment — just an honest look at your family's screen habits across four dimensions. Knowledge is power.
subject: your family

previewCta.title: Get your family's screen habits report with an action plan
previewCta.body: Which habits are fine, which are worth changing, and a realistic week-by-week plan to shift the balance — without going cold turkey or starting a war.

title: How Emotionally Intelligent Is Your Child?
description: See where your child shines emotionally — and where they're still growing. A strength-focused look at four key areas.
subject: your child

previewCta.title: Get your child's complete emotional development map
previewCta.body: Detailed scores across all four dimensions — which skills are strongest, which are still building, and specific daily activities to nurture each area at your child's level.

notes: Currently built as single-choice Type A with 10 questions. Target: regenerate as Likert with 20 statements.

title: How Strong Is Your Child's Social Confidence?
description: Not "is your kid popular" — a strengths-based look at the four skills that predict social success at any age.

previewCta.title: Get your child's social confidence profile with coaching tips

title: How Safe Does Your Child Feel Talking to You?
description: The conversations they bring to you — and the ones they don't — tell a story. See how open the channel really is.

previewCta.title: Get your communication openness report with conversation scripts
previewCta.body: Which channels are wide open, which are narrower than you think, and exact phrases to use after conflict, during hard conversations, and when they shut down.

previewCta.title: Get your child's personalized bedtime routine
previewCta.body: A step-by-step evening sequence matched to your child's sleep personality — what to do, in what order, how long each step takes, and what to say when they resist.

description: Get a personalized chore list matched to your child's actual abilities — not a generic age chart.

previewCta.title: Get your child's personalized chore list with teaching tips
previewCta.body: Specific chores matched to your child's actual abilities — what they can do independently, what needs supervision, and how to introduce each one without it turning into a battle.
